text.text:
Hey there, if you're reading this message, it indicates that your team currently has a low quarantine score. It's crucial to elevate your score to meet the *required threshold of 85 before the grace period expires on 2025-09-15*.

Please note that failure to reach the threshold before the grace period concludes will result in the *AUTOMATIC BLOCKING* of all *PULL REQUESTS* from your team. If your team encounter challenges or require guidance, please reach out to <#C0125D6G44U|squad-web-foundation> for assistance and advice.
Find quarantined files in the replies of this message :point_down:

elements.text:
Good morning team,
Just so you are aware, we are unable to checkout on

at the moment. There seems to be a PR merged on Friday that made a change to the API which now strictly requires a JWT token for authentication. It seems that it works for HF, but the authorization header is missing from calls being made for TPT and FJ at least.
and it seems someone else had reported it on Friday as well.

attachments.fallback:
[September 1st, 2025 12:49 AM] andrea.costa: Good morning team,
Just so you are aware, we are unable to checkout on *staging* at the moment. There seems to be a PR merged on Friday that made a change to the API which now strictly requires a JWT token for authentication. It seems that it works for HF, but the authorization header is missing from calls being made for TPT and FJ at least.
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C066YCULXE0/p1756711029765069|I've reported> it to <#C066YCULXE0|> and it seems someone else had reported it on Friday as well.
attachments.text:
Good morning team,
Just so you are aware, we are unable to checkout on *staging* at the moment. There seems to be a PR merged on Friday that made a change to the API which now strictly requires a JWT token for authentication. It seems that it works for HF, but the authorization header is missing from calls being made for TPT and FJ at least.
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C066YCULXE0/p1756711029765069|I've reported> it to <#C066YCULXE0|> and it seems someone else had reported it on Friday as well.

<@U022DLAHBUY>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Low Priority - robots.txt & AI Visibility `
*Topic:* `Other`
*Description:* `We would like to update the robots.txt file on our site to explicitly allow AI models to utilize our site content. This will improve our AI visibility and hopefully increase the frequency in which we're included in AI responses (e.g. what are some of the best dog food delivery services?) 

Here are the directives we'd like to add:
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1S-l5ZEmdSt9mxZdXiqkARHoNpUdKz-zFm7E4kea6kco/edit?usp=sharing>`
*Expected behaviour:* `Not explicitly allowing AI models to "crawl"`
*Actual behaviour:* `Allowing models to "crawl"`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue

_thread_replies.text:
Hi Philip :wave:
Thanks for reaching out.
I talked to the team and we don't think data-access should have any logic, as it can turn into a new redux nightmare.
This way we're also avoiding any potential issues that might come with this change on TPT.
A suggestion would be that instead of modifying the useCustomerSubscriptions hook directly, you can retrieve the data you get from this hook, and create an additional layer that only RTE Programs would use.

elements.text:
Thanks for reaching out.
I talked to the team and we don't think data-access should have any logic, as it can turn into a new redux nightmare.
This way we're also avoiding any potential issues that might come with this change on TPT.
A suggestion would be that instead of modifying the useCustomerSubscriptions hook directly, you can retrieve the data you get from this hook, and create an additional layer that only RTE Programs would use.

_thread_replies.text:
Hi Andrea,
Thanks for looking into this. :thank-you:
The reason for moving this to the data-access layer was to have the subscription sorted at the root. As such the existing subscriptions are not removed but only the subscription object that has `is_program_weightloss`  tag in the `subscription.productType.family.tags` object are moved to the end.
This is due to the reliance of the non-program (existing) funnel relying on the 1st subscription to determine the account's status. It worked well on Factor when there was only 1 subscription type but with the introduction of program as a separate type, we encountered situations where when if the "program" account was inactive and if the user had an active "non-program" account, the user would be asked to reactivate even when on an active account type.
There was an RFC to this effect here - <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Aik9c-F_B-sX98II2X0iu_Ak49jXKpEPegmhl2ubjtk/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.wm4n9p5jl82t> . Tagging in the contributors <@U04K27HGFT8> and <@U0MBX09UZ> to add to the above points.

files.name: [RFC] Handling Multiple Meals Subscriptions in the WL Space
files.title: [RFC] Handling Multiple Meals Subscriptions in the WL Space

Hi Andrea,
Thanks for looking into this.
The reason for moving this to the data-access layer was to have the subscription sorted at the root. As such the existing subscriptions are not removed but only the subscription object that has

object are moved to the end.
This is due to the reliance of the non-program (existing) funnel relying on the 1st subscription to determine the account's status. It worked well on Factor when there was only 1 subscription type but with the introduction of program as a separate type, we encountered situations where when if the "program" account was inactive and if the user had an active "non-program" account, the user would be asked to reactivate even when on an active account type.
There was an RFC to this effect here -
to add to the above points.

_thread_replies.text:
Thanks for taking a look and discussing with the team <@U03UN2C25UL>! The root issue is not something that impacts programs pages, but rather non-programs pages (my-deliveries, for example). As the RFC notes, there are several cases where a subscription is indiscriminately referenced from the subscriptions array returned from `useCustomerSubscriptions`  as `subscriptions[0]`. This is a problem for users that have a deactivated program and an active core Factor subscription because the subscriptions are sorted by createdAt date. This results in cases where there are references in core Factor that take `subscriptions[0]`, expecting it to be a core subscription, but it's not.

By sorting our programs subscriptions to the bottom, we have a neat solution for this. We are 1) seeing if there are subscriptions that match the programs criteria and then 2) sorting them to the bottom of the array. We believe other solutions such as filtering out programs subscriptions or modifying every instance of `subscriptions[0]` to be more explicit (there are 93 files where this happens) have a greater blast radius and increase the chance of missed cases. While sorting in the data-access `select` method is not perfect, we believe it is a strong enough solution while a more robust operation is considered and implemented in the future :praycat:

elements.text: Thanks for taking a look and discussing with the team

_thread_replies.text: the solution looks like a gambiarra :gambiarra: , and maybe it is, but we believed it's the safest and simplest solution we can implement now, as we design a data-processor operation that fetches subscriptions and sorts+filters them based on some criteria

_thread_replies.text:
Hey all, we understand why you want to use this approach and we don't want to keep blocking this so I'm ok with approving this for now, but my question is are we planning on addressing this anytime soon? If not then would it be better to follow this up with another change (maybe branching this out into a separate data-access hook?)

Although this approach minimizes the blast radius in terms of code changes, it maximizes the blast radius when it comes to brands since this is a core hook that's used by many (all?) brands. I looked at the code and I don't see any big concerns, my bigger concern is how others might start building on top of this logic more and more as time goes on

Although this approach minimizes the blast radius in terms of code changes, it maximizes the blast radius when it comes to brands since this is a core hook that's used by many (all?) brands. _thread_replies.text:
Thats a valid consideration. Immediately we do not have a plan to change this implementation. Not sure if a wider discussion is in progress that I am unaware of.
Merged in the changes and I'm keeping an eye out if there is any impact. Should have a good 4-5 hours of visibility before EOD to look out for any side effects.

attachments.fallback:
[July 11th, 2025 1:04 AM] damian.tylczynski: :memo: *"PATCH /subscription" for Delivery updates End of Life*

Dear Deliveries clients (*web, mobile & internal backend* services),

As a part of Consumer Core strategy and *Alliance KR* we are in process of moving the source of truth of Deliveries information from Intfood to CDPS; introducing a *new Deliveries API* and taking over all the APIv2 endpoints that modify Delivery information.

To be able to achieve that we ask all the clients that are using *PATCH /subscription* (mixing concern of many entities) for the purpose of changing delivery information to simply switch to existing APIv2 *POST /plans/{id}/changePlanDeliveryDetails* endpoint. This is the only way we can guarantee that the use-cases will be successfully supported after switching the source of truth to the new system. All the API calls that are being done to *PATCH /subscription* will stop to update the Delivery entities.

:hourglass_flowing_sand: *Due Date:* 31 July.

We see following clients (cc among others <@UEZ4PRFKM> <@U06L36ATUCD> <@U0708FBKN30>) updating the delivery option/interval using this endpoint:
 Android app
 iPhone app
 GreenChef Mobile App (Android)
 whitelabel-mobile/Everyplate
 whitelable-mobile/Youfoodz
 Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-window
 Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-address
 Web: /my-account/deliveries/menu
 Web: /settings/plan/delivery-address
 Web: /settings/plan/reactivate
 Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-interval
We have prepared <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPLAT/pages/5490737211/PATCH+subscription+for+Delivery+updates+End+of+Life|description of the change requested> and *we would like to know back from you* in the :thread: the feasibility of such change in your client.
attachments.text:
:memo: *"PATCH /subscription" for Delivery updates End of Life*

Dear Deliveries clients (*web, mobile & internal backend* services),

As a part of Consumer Core strategy and *Alliance KR* we are in process of moving the source of truth of Deliveries information from Intfood to CDPS; introducing a *new Deliveries API* and taking over all the APIv2 endpoints that modify Delivery information.

To be able to achieve that we ask all the clients that are using *PATCH /subscription* (mixing concern of many entities) for the purpose of changing delivery information to simply switch to existing APIv2 *POST /plans/{id}/changePlanDeliveryDetails* endpoint. This is the only way we can guarantee that the use-cases will be successfully supported after switching the source of truth to the new system. All the API calls that are being done to *PATCH /subscription* will stop to update the Delivery entities.

:hourglass_flowing_sand: *Due Date:* 31 July.

We see following clients (cc among others <@UEZ4PRFKM> <@U06L36ATUCD> <@U0708FBKN30>) updating the delivery option/interval using this endpoint:
 Android app
 iPhone app
 GreenChef Mobile App (Android)
 whitelabel-mobile/Everyplate
 whitelable-mobile/Youfoodz
 Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-window
 Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-address
 Web: /my-account/deliveries/menu
 Web: /settings/plan/delivery-address
 Web: /settings/plan/reactivate
 Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-interval
We have prepared <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPLAT/pages/5490737211/PATCH+subscription+for+Delivery+updates+End+of+Life|description of the change requested> and *we would like to know back from you* in the :thread: the feasibility of such change in your client.
